reviewText: Before I start off with my story about this DVD, I must say that this is "one heck" of a package! If this is not in your Kylie collection, then why are you reading this? Obviously, you're not a Kylie fan! Kylie...thank you again for coming out with another remarkable treat! I waited 5 years to finally get my hand on this, cause it originally was not available for the US market, so this brings me to my story about this DVD. When this first came out in 2007 I was so stoked to get a copy, I already had "On The Go: Live In Japan", "Live In Sydney", "KylieFever2002", "Greatest Hits 87-97 (DVD)", "Body Language Live", "Ultimate Kylie (DVD)", and "Showgirl: The Greatest Hits Tour". As you can see, I try to get every DVD that Kylie puts out cause living in the states it's so hard to get anything on Kylie (yes the US market is horrible on music). But anyways, like I said I was so stoked when this first came out, unfortunately like any Kylie fan in the US, I was disappointed, this was only available outside the US so it would not play in our region. Now, I don't know when they finally made this available here for us US fans but I was just browsing through Amazon last month checking up on Kylie DVD's, to my surprise this DVD was being advertised as NTSC format and Region free. I was a bit skeptical cause I know sometimes the discriptions can be wrong, so I read the reviewers who's made the purchase already. Most were saying they had no problems playing this on there US players, then there were some that said it would not play at all or it will play part of it and just stop. Even one said that it played disc 1 (movie) but not disc 2 (concert). So, I wasn't too sure about purchasing this after reading the reviews. A month later (last week), I thought, well there were more good reviews than bad so I finally ordered it last week and just got it today, brand new in its shrink wrap. When I opened it I only saw one disc in a one disc slot case, I was freakin out thinking I got ripped off, I was thinking I ordered this brand new, how can this be? Then the funny part was when I removed the disc from its slot the second disc was underneath. Apparently, the case is a single slot, double disc holder, I thought ok, this is neat. I played both disc to make sure they played and it was wonderful! Now, this package is almost 4 and half hours long so I haven't watched it all, but with what I've already seen, this is an amazing concert in an amazing package! It was so awesome to see Kylie's kid sister, Danni, perform Kids with Kylie (I wish Danni's DVD's was available for US market too). Can't wait to watch the movie portion (documentary) tonight. Just thinking of 2 hours with Kylie in Kylie's own words gets me excited! Ok, so there you have it! My story about this DVD in how it took me 5 years to own it, but so worth the wait! A few years back I even thought, well, I have "Showgirl: The Greatest Hits Tour", it can't be much different from that. Boy, was I wrong. It is so much different that this is a whole new concert and package, any Kylie fan will understand that. So if you haven't gotten this yet, I suggest you do. This is a 5 star times 2 rating, great production, great performance, and great packaging. By the way, I also got my "Live In Dublin" DVD today also, so check out my review on that as well.
summary: This DVD Is "Some Kind Of Bliss" ! ! !

reviewText: WHITE DIAMOND**As seen at selected cinemas and on TV**Ultimately, I found WHITE DIAMOND to be a feature length `Behind The Scenes' for the SHOWGIRL: HOMECOMING tour. We meet the backing singers, dancers, wardrobe assistants, Kylie's manager, vocal trainer & 'friend' Bono (U2). Despite this impressive entourage, there's nothing really exciting going on most of the time, unless you count the edge-of-your-seat thrill of a late dancer.Kylie - the reason this documentary exists - comes of as little more then a giggly, smiley character in a children's TV program. She automatically puts on an act whenever she sees a camera. her speeches are practiced and there's rarely any real emotion shown. You have to wonder what got cut out. We see her turning off the camera when she's had enough, and the only hard(ish) hitting question she is asked; "Do you feel trapped [by fame]" goes unanswered.  To put it bluntly; The Saintly image she works so hard to perfect is boring. I used to be a massive fan, but her image obsession has put me right off.The only gritty parts are when we see a tired Kylie sleeping on her dressing room floor. Seeing the hundreds of people in WHITE DIAMOND, and then considering the fact that her sister is the only person to voice concerns over Kylie's health, is very sad. Is everyone milking Kylie, or is she - a well known workaholic - pushing them? Either way, here's WHITE DIAMONDS message; Money over health and wellbeing.Something that really grated on me is the `Director'. I'm not a fanatic who hates everyone who is close to and/or is competition to Saint Kylie i.e. William Baker, Dannii, Madonna etc, but really. I thought directors mainly worked behind the camera, but Will is in nearly every frame. He drapes himself over Kylie constantly, cries over her performance with her sister & generally annoys everyone. Kylie is indeed a Saint, for putting up with him.If you are interested in the behind the scenes workings that go into a tour, you'll love this. If you love Kylie or William Baker you'll really love this.Wanting to keep her private life private is absolutely fine; just don't promise something you have no intention of delivering.As we've already seen the documentary before, there is bonus material in the form of one of Kylie's `Kids' duets, with sister Dannii (The performance is edited differently to Dannii's DVD).This is one of the highlights; no fancy backdrops, no dancers, just the two of them giving a cool performance together for the first time in 20 years.SHOWGIRL: THE HOMECOMING** Warning: I will be discussing parts of the play list. So if you don't want to know, please don't read this review. **Well, it's here. Kylie's comeback tour (did she ever go away?) is here & no doubt will fly off the shelves. The SHOWGIRL: HOMECOMEING tour is pure entertainment, with fabulous dancers, set pieces & costumes, as well as Ms Minogue herself.I can't help to compare HOMECOMING to the lofty standards of the original SHOWGIRL tour, and I'm afraid it just falls short of the mark. Not that second place is so bad.My biggest bugbears are with `Somewhere Over The Rainbow' and the encore. Having a classic song by another artist is great, but did Kylie really have to have `Rainbow' again? It shows of the fact that Kylie has a decent set of lungs on her, but something new would have been appreciated.It's the same with the encore, which is also the same as the original SHOWGIRL. I'd avoided all gossip of the tour & the reviews before I went to see HOMECOMING, so when the same songs were sung I felt a bit let down after all the excitement & suspense beforehand.And I know the set list was going to be changed in some places, after all Kylie is making a fresh start in her career. I didn't miss `Please Stay' (it wasn't a great single) and `In Denial' is a great song, but as it's a duet it didn't really work last time, so I can see why it was dropped this time.But on the other hand `Put Yourself In My Place' is a classic song, nearly as good as `Confide In Me' in my opinion, so I really missed it. I also really missed non-single track `Your Disco Needs You`, which is pure fun, and was a real crowd pleaser last time.Speaking of changed set lists, I must admit that I found the `temple' section a bit dull. I've already mentioned that `Confide In Me' is a real classic, so it pains me to say that it was a bit lacklustre here. The other 3 songs in this section are `Cowboy Style' (I think this was an Oz only single), I don't rate this song, and the lyrics are a nonsensical jumble. I would have liked to have had `Breathe' in its place. Then the backing singers perform `Finer Feelings' a superb but sadly underrated Kylie single. The final song in this section is `Too Far'. Having a non-single from her least successful album (IMPOSSIBLE PRINCESS) must be a personal choice, but it's boring & the audience will be distanced in my opinion. I'll be skipping this section on the DVD.'Kids' is sung with her backing singers, not with Bono as stated on Amazon. (This was also on the EMI website. Tut tut)But now my gripes are out of the way lets discuss the best bits!!The opener `Better The Devil You Know' is a classic and never fails to put a smile on my face.Non album track `White Diamond' (wrote by Scissor Scissors) is something a little more personal, yet it's still nice and upbeat.FEVER non single `Burning Up' is mashed up with the Madonna classic `Vogue', acknowledging the people who call her a copycat. It worked surprisingly well. Kylie is not best known for attitude, but she's certainly capable of giving it!!Two more non singles are mashed up for her closing song. `Light Years' (same named album) is lovingly performed with `Turn It Into Love' (KYLIE), making this song personal for the audience who continue to support her.The costumes may not be pretty, but they are bold. The most interesting choices for a Kylie concert, ever.I've already mentioned the sadly missing songs, but we do get them as a bonus. `In Denial', Je Ne Sais Pas Pourquoi', `Please Stay' and `Your Disco Needs You' are all here, edited differently to the original SHOWGIRL DVD.This DVD set may be mis-titled as a 'Personal Portrait' when it clearly isn't, but the documentary is still a must have for any devoted Kylie fan. Everyone else; Go straight to the concert disc & leave the documentary alone.

reviewText: White Diamond-Finally, North American Kylie fans get to see the beautiful documentry "White Diamond". The film was directed by Kylie's stylist, gay husband, photographer, and so much more, William Baker. I don't agree with everything that William Baker does with Kylie but I have to say that he made an absolutely beautiful film about Kylie. The film starts in the Summer of 2006 when rehearsals for the Showgirl Homecoming tour starts. It shows Kylie rehearsing the dancers and band and also visiting Dolce & Gabbana and Chanel for her costumes.The first night of her tour is very exciting and ends with Kylie laying on the floor because she was so drained. The film shows a lot of the Australia tour dates, including when both Bono and her sister, Dannii come to sing with her. It shows how exhausted Kylie became after performing so much. The tour then moves to the shows in England. We get to see a little bit of Kylie and Olivier's romance at the New Year's Eve show. They are no longer together but I think it showed her fans that they truly were in love. One of the hardest bits to watch was when she had to cancel one of her Manchester shows because she was ill. It was sad to watch because she obviously wanted to perform and not let her fans down but she was too ill to continue with the show.I really, really enjoyed the documentry. I got a bit emotional at the beginning and during the Manchester show but I didn't cry too much. I did notice that Kylie really seemed against the film at times. She doesn't like to reveal a lot of herself to the public and there were a few times when she would raise her hand to the camera to tell them to stop filming. But I really appreciate that she went through with making the documentry. My favorite parts of the film are the things that happened in Kylie's dressing room. Kylie, William, and Leanne (Kylie's personal assistant) played with Photobooth on Kylie's Mac and it was so funny. Also the two times that they showed Kylie and her group dancing and being giggly. Another great moment is when Dannni came to sing "Kids" with Kylie and you see how much she and Kylie support and love each other.The bonus footage on the disc is the full version of Kylie and Dannii Minogue singing "Kids"Showgirl Homecoming:The concert was filmed in Kylie's hometown of Melbourne, Australia. The opening of the concert when Kylie rises to the stage gave me goosebumps and a big smile on my face. It's so great to see Kylie back on stage. One of the songs at the beginning is a song called "White Diamond". It didn't make the cut on Kylie's cd "X" but I think it worked well on the Showgirl Homecoming tour.I think the concert is a fantastic mix of beautiful images and also it's pure fun to watch. My favorite section of the show is when she sings "Confide in me", "Cowboy style", and "Too far". She used a Middle Eastern flair to this section. "Confide in me" is a favorite of mine because Kylie is like a puppet on a string and two of the dancer control her moves.The overall effect is really cool. I also like the "Dreams" section when Kylie is on the moon, as she was in the first Showgirl tour. It looks so beautiful.  Another great moment is during a break when the dancer that the fans call "Manchester Boy" (stemming from his appearance in Kylie's 2002 Fever concert when she called him that) does a solo to Kylie's song "Butterfly". His real name is Terry and he's an acrobat. He does a lot of flips and does a handstand while going down the stage stairs. It's really cool. My last favorite moment is near the end of the show when a fan gives Kylie a t-shirt that says "Char says relax". Char was Kylie's character in the Australian soap "Neighbours". It's a cute moment.The concert is really fantastic and I think I like a little bit better than the Showgirl concert in 2005. Maybe because this time, Kylie's seems really into the show and like she's giving it her all. Bonus features on the Showgirl Homecoming DVD are re-edits of some of her 2005 Showgirl concert and also wallpapers and a screensaver for your computer.So if you're a Kylie fan, you should definitely pick up this 2 DVD set because you won't regret.

reviewText: A personal look at super pop-star Kylie Minogue behind the scenes during one of the most crucial times in her life. After having received her cancer diagnosis, Kylie was forced to reschedule part of her tour. This is the story of how she fought cancer to keep her promise to fans. The show after all must go on.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I am a Kylie Minogue Fan, when she was diagnosed with Breast Cancer I did something special until the day I heard she got back to stage... When her live double disc cd Show Girl Home Coming Live came out I bought with out even thinking about it, I was just glad she was back... But this documentary to me it's not about music, shows or tours, to me it's about Kylie being a "SURVIVOR" in her battle... This film it's was not as emotional as I thought I was going to be, somehow I thought it was filmed while she was battling the cancer, but make no mistake seeing Kylie up in stage again gave me chills... Hearing her sister speaking about how Kylie only her self can know when it's the right time to start again was very heart warming, she also said that what Kylie gets from performing it's all she needs to go on... I respect Kylie as an artist this film shows some what how emotional was coming back onstage for her... I gave it 4 starts just because the film shows a lot of technical aspects like picking the dancers and stuff like that, I thought it would be more of her personal battle with coming back... I loved it though because a lot of moments were very raw and real, honest you might say, I did see a bunch of stuff we as audience don't get to see... Welcome back Kylie, I was glad to hear her responce when she was ask:"why do you do it?" and she didn't answer, he asked:"do you do it for the 12,000 people out there?" to this she answer:"I would do it just for 2 it's all I know what to do"... Spoken like a true artist...

reviewerName: Lil' Radio "It's all to the good"
reviewText: This is a great buy for all the die-hard KM fans! A 2-disc DVD set of both her documentary titled "White Diamond" and her Showgirl - Homecoming Tour! Here's a summary of disc 1:basically, it's a documentary that goes behind the scnenes of the Showgirl Homecoming Tour. You get to see Kylie meeting with fashion designers Dolce and Gabbana who worked on one of her costumes. You also get to see Kylie during rehearsals and her personality offstage. A nice bonus feature to this DVD is the performance of Kids with her sister Dannii Minogue. The documentary was showcased in theatres in Australia and was received negative reviews by critics because Kylie wasn't acting like a "diva"(I guess the critics wanted this to be like Madge'sMadonna - Truth or Dare). Personally, I enjoyed the documentary - it shows how Kylie has a warm and caring personality.Here's disc 2:Kylie returns to the stage to continue her Showgirl Tour. Her previous Showgirl Tour was postponed due to her battle with first stage breast cancer. Now, she's back and ready to take on the world! The set is the same with new additions of LCD screens and costumes. Here's the setlist:ACT 1: Homecoming - Kylie appears in a pink feathered showgirl dress1. Overture/Better The Devil You Know - Kylie returns to her hometown Melbourne, Australia and receives a standing ovation from the crowd as she appears on stage.2. In Your Eyes3. White Diamond4. On A Night Like ThisACT 2: Everything Taboo - a little reminiscent of Janet Jackson's Whimsical Medley during her tours5. Shocked6. What Do I Have To Do?7. Spinning AroundACT 3: Samsara - this act replaced the Denial act from the Showgirl 2005 Tour. The stage is set like a desert8. Confide In Me - has a middle eastern feel to it. Kylie's dancers control Kylie as if she were a puppet.9. Cowboy Style10. Finer Feelings - a snippet performed by Kylie's backing vocalist while Kylie dances with her dancers11. Too Far - it's really cool that Kylie resurrected TF - her vocals are flawless as she hits the soprano range during the bridge!ACT 4: Athletica - the stage is set as a gym12. Butterfly (Sandstorm Dub) - an interlude which features an acrobat13. Red Blooded Woman - Kylie is dressed as a kangaroo-cat like boxer.14. Slow15. Kids - Kylie struts the stage and performs with her backing vocalistsACT 5: Dreams - Kylie wears a stunning red dress16. Somewhere Over The Rainbow - Kylie sings on a moon17. Come Into My World - the song is performed as a ballad as Kylie sings on the moon.18. Chocolate19. I Believe In You20. DreamsACT 6: Pop Paradiso - Kylie is dressed in a black feathered emsemble21. Burning Up/Vogue - performed as a dance interlude as Kylie sing the rap from Madge'sVogue.22. The Loco-Motion - a jazzy performance just like the Showgirl 2005 show.23. I Should Be So Lucky24. Hand On Your Heart - a remixed versionACT 7: Dance of the Cybermen - Kylie and her dancers are dressed as robots25. Can't Get You Out Of My Head - the intro is from Dr. Who and Kylie emerges on the stage to perform her worldwide hit!26. Light Years - Kylie sings some lines from her old hit Turn It Into LoveACT 8: Encore27. Especially For You - performed as a sing-a-long with the audience28. Love At First Sight - a nice way to close the show. The LCD displays Kylie's old videos and tours!Overall opinion: a very enjoyable concert and documentary for all of the KM fans. What are you waiting for? Purchase this DVD!!3.

reviewText: I was somewhat hesitant ordering this Homecoming dvd because of problems with playing on US players.  Luckily, no problems reported at all with what I ordered.  It played beautifully and I enjoyed every minute of this amazing Kylie's Showgirl performance!  Like this show and the Aphrodite concert which I was fortunate to see it live.  Kylie is the Queen and there is no performer who can come close to her concerts in scope and concept, especially when she sings live in all of her performances...no lip synching here like other pop divas.  Her concerts are always jaw-dropping amazing and the production values and concert themes always tops the last tour.  Kylie Rules!
